author.headline: Technical Lead | JavaScript | React | MBA, Team Leadership

summary: With a decade of web development experience and mastery in JavaScript, React.js, and Node.js, I've excelled as a Technical Leader, creating elegant solutions for complex problems.
My leadership extends beyond technical skills, as I've mentored teams on intricate projects and honed management skills like emotional intelligence and conflict resolution.
This blend of technical expertise and leadership has shaped me into a well-rounded Front-End focused Technical Leader.

In addition to technology, I like to photograph landscapes, practice adventure sports, and visit new places whenever possible. I'm always open to exploring new opportunities and making meaningful connections. Let's talk!

olx-4.description: I was the leader of the "Ads Seller Experience" team.
responsibilities: Led a team of 9 developers, serving as a mentor and guiding light;
Delivered the successful execution of the platform's registration and ad management system roadmap including the new Ad Insertion in steps journey;
Built a high level of engagement within the team;
Held personalized "1:1s" to guide team members through their performance cycles;
Adopted agile methodologies and led team ceremonies to ensure a streamlined workflow balancing product and technical tasks;
Worked closely with the Product Manager to facilitate informed and effective product decisions;
olx-4.biggestChallenge: To deal with pressure from leadership to do major deliveries in the short term.

olx-3.description: I was the leader of the "Search & Recommendation" team¹ and the "Design System" chapter².
responsibilities: Led a team of 8 developers, serving as a mentor and guiding light;¹
Delivered the successful execution of the search and recommendation systems roadmap including the new LTR rank algorithm;¹
Structured the team and proposed a new approach to support the strategic plan for the upcoming year;¹
Clarified the company's understanding of search and recommendation subjects;¹
Supervised all developers (9 devs) in the chapter indirectly, fostered a sense of unity and direction;²
Fostered engagement within the chapter and ensured valuable deliveries despite working only once a week;²
olx-3.biggestChallenge: To balance the substantial responsibilities of both the team¹ and the chapter² simultaneously.

olx-2.description: I was the leader of the 'Design System' team.
responsibilities: Led a team of 9 developers, serving as a point of reference;
Partnered with the Design Manager to make optimal product decisions and establish a roadmap;
Delivered the Design System roadmap including an entirely new platform homepage created in less than 48 hours;
Gathered and analyzed data to validate the project's value to the company;
Ensured the continuous evolution of the Design System and its adoption by other teams;
Developed documentation and processes for contributing to the Design System project and managing its version;
olx-2.biggestChallenge: To assume multiple roles simultaneously, including Engineering Manager, Product Manager, Data Analyst, among others.

olx-1.description: I was the leader of the "Advertising" team.
responsibilities: Led a team of 7 developers, serving as a key reference;
Delivered both direct and indirect Advertising roadmaps for the platform that brought R$80 million in revenue;
Recruited new professionals to increase productive capacity in 300%;
Partnered actively with the Product Manager to prioritize and develop optimal initiatives;
Proposed a new structure for the Advertising area to enhance results;
olx-1.biggestChallenge: To manage high expectations related to Advertising revenue results.

meaning-1.description: I held the position of CTO and co-founder at the startup.
responsibilities: Crafted the startup's technical vision and product strategy;
Architected the solution from the ground up;
Refined the product's technical specifications;
Developed a Proof of Concept project;
meaning-1.biggestChallenge: To convert a highly "human-centric" project, rooted in personal consultancy, into a systematic approach.

softplan-3.description: I was the leader of the "Estônia" team.
responsibilities: Led directly a multidisciplinary software development team, inclusive of Software Architects, Developers, Quality Assurance Analysts, Product Owners, Business Analysts, and Agile Masters;
Mentored and developed both direct and indirect employees, utilizing techniques such as 1:1 and feedforward;
Planned and executed deliveries for the most 2 critical modules of the "SAJ" system;
Applied daily situational leadership to maximize the potential of those under my guidance;
Structured and continuously enhanced the team's workflow using agile software development methodologies;
Created formulas and metrics to accurately gauge the team's capacity, thereby bringing predictability to deliveries;
Mapped effective talent retention strategies;
softplan-3.biggestChallenge: To manage a large team (28 professionals) and oversee critical deliveries.

softplan-2.description: I was the technical leader of the Front-End chapter.
responsibilities: Developed the new "SAJ" system, constructed using React JS, .Net, and GraphQL;
Oversaw the deliveries and deployment of 17 modules of the system;
Provided training in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React JS, GraphQL, and unit tests;
Led a team of 10 Front-End React developers;
Recruited new employees for the company;
Selected new contractor professionals;
Developed professionals through 1:1 sessions, Feedforwards, and Mentoring;
softplan-2.biggestChallenge: To acquire leadership skills and master people management.

softplan-1.description: I was a Senior Front-End developer on the "França" team.
responsibilities: Developed new features for the "e-SAJ" portal utilizing React JS and GraphQL;
Created new features for the "SAJ Tribunais" system using React JS and GraphQL;
softplan-1.biggestChallenge: To manage all the deliveries of the project as the sole Front-End developer.

hotmart-3.description: I was a Senior Front-End developer on the "Growth Hacking" team.
responsibilities: Developed systems to address the company's internal needs and automate tasks, leveraging technologies such as Vue.js, and Node.js;
Created a Proof of Concept (POC) that introduced a simplified method for product registration on the platform;
hotmart-3.biggestChallenge: To balance the need to comprehend customer requirements clearly while simultaneously coding.

hotmart-2.description: I was a Mid Level Front-End developer on the "User Acquisition" team.
responsibilities: Designed a system to generate blog post images using components and pre-defined templates, thereby enhancing the productivity of the design team;
Developed a high-performance caching system for the "Hotmart blog" (WordPress), which resulted in a 300% increase in performance;
Implemented the Arabic version of the "Hotmart blog";
hotmart-2.biggestChallenge: To conceptualize and develop complex solutions from the ground up.

hotmart-1.description: I was an Entry Level Front-End developer on the "User Acquisition" team.
responsibilities: Developed a new WordPress theme for the "Hotmart blog" utilizing only HTML5, CSS Grid Layout, and Vanilla JS;
Implemented the new layout for the "Hotmart blog";
Created custom features within the WordPress admin interface;
hotmart-1.biggestChallenge: To acquire new development skills and apply them to complex projects.

sydle-2.description: I was a Support Analyst on the "Suporte & Sustentação" team.
responsibilities: Spearheaded the development of web projects utilizing WordPress and Magento;
Facilitated the modeling and automation of the company's internal processes through BPMN;
Provided comprehensive technical support to users of the company's systems;
Oversaw the configuration and monitoring of both Linux and Windows servers.
sydle-2.biggestChallenge: To rapidly acquire development skills and contribute to legacy projects.

sydle-1.description: I was a Support Intern on the "Suporte & Sustentação" team.
responsibilities: Provided technical support to users of the company's systems;
Configured and monitored infrastructure on Linux and Windows servers;
Compiled team reports;
Offered infrastructure support to the company's employees.
sydle-1.biggestChallenge: To simultaneously learn a multitude of new concepts and balance them with my university commitments.
